<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 
99.1</font></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial 
Statements</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">(Stated in Canadian Dollars)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Second Quarter Ended June 30, 
2015</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">(Unaudited)</font></div>

INDENT: 0pt">

</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Consolidated Statements of Comprehensive Loss 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">(in Canadian Dollars, in thousands except 
for share data)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><br>

<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">June 30, 2015 and 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">(in Canadian Dollars, in thousands except 
for share data)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">1.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">NATURE OF OPERATIONS</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Rubicon Minerals Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) has 
been primarily involved in the acquisition, exploration and development of 
mineral property interests in Canada and the United States. The Company is 
incorporated and domiciled in British Columbia, Canada. The address of its 
registered office is Suite 2800 - 666 Burrard Street&#160;Vancouver, BC V6C 2Z7.
The Company maintains its head office at 44 Victoria Street, Suite 400, Toronto,
Ontario M5C 1Y2.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The ability of the Company to recover the costs it has incurred
to date on its properties, including the Phoenix Gold Project, is dependent upon
profitable extraction of gold or other minerals from its properties, the ability
of the Company to resolve any environmental, regulatory, or other constraints 
which may hinder the successful operation and expansion of its properties, 
obtaining financing to complete exploration and development, and upon future 
profitable production or proceeds from disposition of mineral 
properties.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Although the Company is unaware of any defects in its title to 
its mineral properties, no guarantee can be made that none exist.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">2.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">BASIS OF PRESENTATION</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">a)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Statement of compliance</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company prepares its annual financial statements in 
accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#8220;IFRS&#8221;)
as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;IASB&#8221;), 
and with interpretations of the International Financial Reporting Committee 
which the Canadian Accounting Standards Board has approved for incorporation 
into Part 1 of the CPA Canada Handbook - Accounting. These interim consolidated 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International 
Accounting Standard 34, &#8220;Interim Financial Reporting&#8221; (&#8220;IAS 
34&#8221;). Accordingly, these interim consolidated financial statements follow 
the same accounting principles and methods of application as the annual 
consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2014 except as
noted below and may condense or omit certain disclosures that otherwise would be
present in annual financial statements prepared in accordance with IFRS. These 
financial statements should therefore be read in conjunction with the December 
31, 2014 financial statements. These financial statements were authorized for 
issuance by the Audit Committee on behalf of the Board of Directors on August 
10, 2015.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Certain reclassifications have been made to the prior period 
financial statements to conform with the current period presentation, and 
increases the understanding of the Company&#8217;s operations and results in 
classifications that are more comparable to its peers.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">b)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Significant accounting judgments and sources
of estimation uncertainty</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The preparation of financial statements in conformity with IFRS
requires management to make judgments, estimates and assumptions that affect the
reported amounts and the valuation of assets and liabilities and the disclosure 
of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenues and expenditures during the period reported. 
Management uses its best estimates for these purposes, based on assumptions that
it believes reflect the most probable set of economic conditions and planned 
courses of action. While actual results could differ materially from these 
estimates, and other than as described below in impairment of non-current non-
financial assets and financial liabilities at fair value through profit and 
loss, no specific sources of estimation uncertainty have been identified by 
management that are believed to have a significant risk of resulting in a 
material adjustment within the next financial year to the carrying amount of the
Company&#8217;s assets and liabilities as recorded at June 30, 
2015.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The most significant judgments and estimates made by management
in preparing the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements are described
as follows:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Impairment of non-current non-financial 
assets</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company reviews and evaluates the carrying value of each of
its non-current non-financial assets for impairment when events or changes in 
circumstances indicate that the carrying amounts of the related asset may not be
recoverable. The</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-&#160;<font 
style="FONT-STYLE: normal">6 </font></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">-</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">June 30, 2015 and 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">(in Canadian Dollars, in thousands except 
for share data)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
&#160;</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">2.</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">BASIS OF 
PRESENTATION</font><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: 
inline">(continued)</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">identification of such events or changes and the performance of
the assessment requires significant judgment. Furthermore, management&#8217;s 
estimates of many of the factors relevant to completing this assessment, 
including commodity prices, foreign </font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">currency exchange rates, mineral 
resources, and operating, capital and reclamation costs, are subject to risks 
and uncertainties that may further affect the determination of the 
recoverability of the carrying amounts of its non-current non-financial 
assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">At each reporting period, management reviews property plant and
equipment, and exploration and evaluation assets for indicators of impairment. 
If any such indicator exists, the recoverable amount of the asset is estimated 
to determine the extent </font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times 
New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">of the impairment, if any. The recoverable amount is
the higher of fair value less costs to sell and value in use. Fair value is 
determined as the amount that would be obtained from the sale of the asset in an
arm&#8217;s length transaction between knowledgeable and willing 
parties.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value of mineral assets is generally determined as the 
present value of the estimated future cash flows expected to arise from the 
continued use of the asset, including any expansion prospects, using a post-tax 
discount rate. Value in use is determined as the present value of the estimated 
future cash flows expected to arise from the continued use of the asset in its 
present form and from its ultimate disposal, using a pre-tax discount 
rate.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">If the recoverable amount of the asset is less than its 
carrying amount, the carrying amount of the asset is reduced to its recoverable 
amount and the impairment loss is recognized in the profit or loss for that 
period. Impairment is normally assessed at the level of cash-generating units 
(&#8220;CGUs&#8221;), which are identified as the smallest identifiable group of
assets that generates cash inflows that are largely independent of the cash 
inflows from other assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Non-financial assets other than goodwill that have been 
impaired are tested for possible reversal of the impairment whenever events or 
changes in circumstances indicate that the impairment may have reversed. When a 
reversal of a previous impairment is recorded, the reversal amount is adjusted 
for depreciation that would have been recorded had the impairment not taken 
place.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The determination of fair value and value in use requires 
management to make estimates and assumptions about expected production and sales
volumes, gold prices, mine plan estimates, operating costs, mine closure and 
restoration costs, future capital expenditures and appropriate discount rates 
for future cash flows. The estimates and assumptions are subject to 
risk</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">and uncertainty, and as such there is the possibility that 
changes in circumstances will alter these projections, which may impact the 
recoverable amount of the assets. In such circumstances, some or all of the 
carrying value of the assets may be further impaired or the impairment charge 
reduced with the impact recorded in the statement of income.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">At June 30, 2015 the Company&#8217;s market capitalization was 
below the carrying amount of the Company&#8217;s net assets.&#160;&#160;Combined
with the volatile gold price, escalating costs in the industry and the 
Company&#8217;s depressed share price, management determined that an impairment 
indicator was identified and an impairment assessment for the Phoenix Gold 
Project was completed including an estimate of the project&#8217;s fair value 
less costs to sell.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Key assumptions incorporated in the impairment model included
the following:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Long term gold price: US$1,263/oz.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Life of Mine gold head grade: 8.06 grams/tonne</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Life of Mine average operating costs: $154/tonne mineralized 
material milled</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Canadian / US dollar exchange rate: $1.17</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Production volume and recoveries as indicated in the 
Company&#8217;s Technical Report filed on SEDAR February 28, 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Discount rate: 5%</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Management&#8217;s impairment assessment did not result in the 
identification of an impairment loss as of June 30, 2015.&#160;&#160;Although 
management believes the estimates applied in these impairment assessments are 
reasonable, such estimates are subject to significant uncertainties and 
judgments. Sensitivities to changes in gold price, grade and estimated operating
costs that differ from current projections, along with increases to estimated 
capital costs may trigger an impairment that could be material.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-&#160;<font 
style="FONT-STYLE: normal">7 </font></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">-</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">2.</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">BASIS OF 
PRESENTATION</font><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: 
inline">(continued)</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Financial liabilities at fair value through 
profit and loss</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As discussed in Note 14 &#8211; Warrant Liability, the Company 
entered into a secured loan facility with CPPIB Credit Investments Inc 
(&#8220;CPPIB&#8221;) for US $50,000 on May 12, 2015.&#160;&#160;As part of the 
loan facility the Company granted CPPIB 10,000,000 common share purchase 
warrants (&#8220;Warrant&#8221;) exercisable on or before May 12, 2020, at a 
price of $1.715 per Warrant.&#160;&#160;The Company reviewed the terms of the 
Warrant agreement and determined that IAS 39 Financial Instruments: Recognition 
and Measurement is the applicable standard under which the accounting for the 
agreement should be evaluated. As the Warrant agreement meets the criteria for 
treatment as a financial liability through profit and loss, the Company 
designated it as such with initial and subsequent measurement at fair 
value.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value of the Warrant Liability on initial recognition and 
in subsequent periods is determined using the Black-Scholes option pricing 
model. Subsequent fair value is calculated on each reporting date with gains and
losses recorded in profit and loss as other fair value adjustments.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As discussed in Note 15 - Gold Stream Facility, the Company 
entered into a Gold Stream Facility with Royal Gold Inc. and its subsidiary 
(<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline">&#8220;</font>Royal Gold&#8221;)
on February 10, 2014. The Company reviewed the terms of the agreement and 
determined that IAS 39 Financial Instruments: Recognition and Measurement is the
applicable standard under which the accounting for the agreement should be 
evaluated. In accordance with this standard, the Company concluded that the 
agreement represents an embedded derivative within a host debt instrument (the 
purchase and sale agreement for gold). As the entire hybrid contract meets the 
criteria for treatment as a financial liability at fair value through profit and
loss, the Company designated it as such with initial and subsequent measurement 
at fair value. Transaction costs directly attributable to the Gold Stream 
Facility are expensed through profit and loss as incurred.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value of the Gold Stream Facility on initial recognition 
is determined by the amount of the cash advance received. Subsequent fair value 
is calculated on each reporting date with gains and losses recorded in profit 
and loss as fair value and foreign exchange adjustments. Components of the
adjustment to fair value at each reporting date include:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div align="center">
<table bgcolor="white" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-

<td width="96%">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; DISPLAY: inline">Accretion expense due to passage of
time</font></font></font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

incurred in USD</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">&#160;</font></td>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font

<td width="96%">

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td width="96%">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font

<td width="96%">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">Change in forward gold price forecast</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Estimates and assumptions underlying the fair value 
calculations are reviewed on an ongoing basis in consideration of experience, 
internal and external sources of information and expectations of future events 
that management believes to be reasonable in the circumstances.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<div align="center">

<td width="96%">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-WEIGHT:

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<td width="96%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

</tr><tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">&#160;</font></td>
<td colspan="2" width="98%">
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline">Long-term Incentive Plan</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In the first quarter of 
2015 the Company established a Long-Term Incentive Plan consisting of Restricted
Share Units and Performance Share Units for directors and certain employees of 
the Company.&#160;&#160;Each performance share unit (&#8220;PSU&#8221;) has the 
same value as one Common Share of the Company at the prevailing market price on 
the TSX.&#160;&#160;The initial fair value of the PSU is calculated as of the 
grant date and is subsequently amortized as part of compensation expense over 
the vesting period.&#160;&#160;The PSUs vest based on the Company achieving 
certain performance targets over a three year period and are settled in 
shares.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">June 30, 2015 and 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">(in Canadian Dollars, in thousands except 
for share data)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">3</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-STYLE: normal"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">(continued)</font></font></font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">Each restricted share unit (&#8220;RSU&#8221;) has the same value as one
Common Share of the Company at the prevailing market price on the 
TSX.&#160;&#160;The initial fair value of the RSU is calculated as of the grant 
date and is subsequently amortized as part of compensation expense over the 
vesting period.&#160;&#160;The RSUs vest one-third on the first, second and 
third anniversary of the grant date and are settled in shares.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 
18pt"></font>Inventories</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.15pt"></font>Inventories 
may include materials and supplies, mineralized material in stockpile, in-
circuit, and finished metal. Inventories are valued at the lower of cost and net
realizable value.&#160;&#160;Cost is determined on a weighted average basis and 
includes all costs incurred, based on a normal production capacity, in bringing 
in each product to its present location and condition.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Net realizable value is determined with reference to relevant 
market prices, less estimated applicable costs of completion.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Borrowing Costs</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Borrowing costs that are directly attributable to the 
acquisition or construction of a qualifying asset are capitalized as part of the
cost of the asset.&#160;&#160;A qualifying asset is one that takes a substantial
period of time to get ready for its intended use.&#160;&#160;Capitalization of 
borrowing costs ceases when the asset is completed and ready for productive 
use.&#160;&#160;All other borrowing costs are recognized as finance costs in the
period in which they are incurred.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div align="center">
<table bgcolor="white" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman">
<tr>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">&#160;</font></td>
<td width="2%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">(b</font></td>
<td width="94%">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline">New standards and interpretations not yet 
adopted</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times 
New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 15, &#8220;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customers&#8221;</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In May 2014, the IASB and the Financial Accounting Standards 
Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) completed its joint project to clarify the principles
for recognizing revenue and to develop a common revenue standard for IFRS and 
United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&#8220;US GAAP&#8221;). 
As a result of the joint project, the IASB issued IFRS 15, Revenue from 
Contracts with Customers (&#8220;IFRS 15&#8221;). IFRS 15 establishes principles
to address the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows
arising from an entity&#8217;s contracts with customers.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 15 will be effective for annual periods beginning on or 
after January 1, 2018, with early adoption permitted. Management is currently 
assessing the effect of this standard on our financial statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 9, &#8220;Financial Instruments&#8221;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The IASB issued its completed version of IFRS 9, Financial 
Instruments (&#8220;IFRS 9&#8221;) in July 2014. The completed standard provides
revised guidance on the classification and measurement of financial assets. It 
also introduces a new expected credit loss model for calculating impairment for 
financial assets. The new hedging guidance that was issued in November 2013 is 
incorporated into this new final standard.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">This final version of IFRS 9 will be effective for annual 
periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018, with early adoption permitted. 
Management is currently assessing the effect of this standard on our financial 
statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">4<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">.</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value hierarchy</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Financial instruments recognized at fair value on the 
consolidated balance sheets must be classified into one of the three following 
fair value hierarchy levels:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Level 1 &#8211; measurement based on quoted prices (unadjusted)
observed in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-&#160;<font 
style="FONT-STYLE: normal">9 </font></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">-</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">June 30, 2015 and 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">(in Canadian Dollars, in thousands except 
for share data)</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">4<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">.</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-
WEIGHT: normal">(continued)</font></font></font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">Level 2 
&#8211; measurement based on inputs other than quoted prices included in Level 
1, that are observable for the asset or liability;</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Level 3 &#8211; measurement based on inputs that are not 
observable (supported by little or no market activity) for the asset or 
liability.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s financial assets recognized at fair value
consist of marketable securities having a fair value of $nil (December 31, 2014 
- $825) and were measured in accordance with Level 1 of the above 
hierarchy.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s financial liabilities recognized at fair 
value through profit and loss consist of the Gold Stream Facility having a fair 
value of $92,827 (December 31, 2014 - $72,937) and measured in accordance with 
Level 3 of the above hierarchy, and the Warrant Liability having a fair value of
$6,418 (December 31, 2015 - $nil), and measured in accordance with Level 2 of 
the above hierarchy.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The fair value of long-term debt approximates the carrying 
amount of $59,049 (December 31, 2014 - $nil).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Financial instrument risks</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s financial instruments are exposed to the 
following risks:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Credit Risk</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s primary exposure to credit risk is the risk
of non-payment of cash and cash equivalents at June 30, 2015 amounted to $77,375
(December 31, 2014 - $120,164).&#160;&#160;These cash and cash equivalents are 
held on deposit with major Canadian banks or in bank guaranteed investment 
certificates which are guaranteed by a major Canadian bank or by a provincial 
government.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As the Company&#8217;s policy is to limit excess cash
investments to deposits or investments with or guaranteed by major Canadian 
banks or the federal or a provincial government, the credit risk is considered 
by management to be negligible.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s credit risk exposure from accounts 
receivable financial instruments, which excludes HST refunds, at June 30, 2015 
amounted to $417 (December 31, 2014 - $3).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Liquidity Risk</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s liquidity risk from financial instruments 
is its need to meet operating accounts payable requirements, commitments, 
finance lease obligations, and debt service payments.&#160;&#160;The Company 
maintains sufficient cash balances to meet these needs.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Foreign Exchange Risk</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Foreign exchange risk is the risk that fluctuations in foreign 
exchange rates may have an effect on future cash flows associated with the 
Company&#8217;s US dollar denominated cash balances and financial instruments. 
Fluctuations in the CAD/USD exchange rate may result in a decrease or increase 
in foreign exchange income or expense. As at June 30, 2015, the foreign exchange
risk related to the US dollar denominated Gold Stream Facility and Long-Term 
Debt was partially offset by the US dollar denominated cash 
balance.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">A change in the CAD/USD exchange rate of 1.0% on the June 30, 
2015 US dollar denominated balances related to&#160;&#160;the Gold Streaming 
Facility, Long-Term Debt, and cash balances, would result in a change to net 
loss of approximately $840.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">-&#160;<font 
style="FONT-STYLE: normal">10 </font></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">-</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>

FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>

</div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RUBICON MINERALS CORPORATION</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements 
(Unaudited)</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">June 30, 2015 and 2014</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">FINANCIAL

WEIGHT: normal">(continued)</font></font></font></font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Interest Rate Risk</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company is exposed to interest rate risk on its cash and 
cash equivalents.&#160;&#160;The majority of these investments are in high 
interest savings accounts and guaranteed investment certificates with pre-
determined fixed yields.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">A difference in interest rates of 1.0%, on the June 30, 2015 
balance of cash and cash equivalents and temporary investments, over a year, 
would result in a change to net loss of approximately $774.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">SUPPLEMENTAL CASH FLOW AND NON-CASH 
ACTIVITIES</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Cash and cash equivalents are comprised of the 
following:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt" align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="98%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

<tr>

0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">June 30</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE:

activities for the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, changes in accounts
payable relating to exploration and evaluation expenditures of $1,418 and $3,074
(June 30, 2014 &#8211; $3,115 and $1,497) and property, plant and equipment 
expenditures of $8,966 and $11,623 (June 30, 2014 &#8211; $2,583 and $1,470). 
Other non-cash items excluded from net cash from (used in) investing activities 
for the three and six months ended June 30, 2015 includes $218 and $265 (June 
30, 2014 &#8211; $20 and $55) recorded in exploration and evaluation 
expenditures for stock-based compensation awarded to personnel working on 
mineral properties and $1,038 and $1,740 (June 30, 2014 &#8211; $456 and $862) 
recorded in exploration and evaluation expenditures for 
depreciation.</font></div>

and equipment during the year:</font></div>
<div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt" align="left">

<td valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double; BORDER-

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">EXPLORATION 
AND EVALUATION ASSETS </font></font></div>

0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The following is a summary of changes in exploration and 
evaluation assets during the period:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt" align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="98%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" width="52%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double; BORDER-
BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double; BORDER-
BOTTOM: black 2px solid; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double;
BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Phoenix Gold <br>
Project</font></div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">11.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ACCOUNTS PAYABLE AND ACCRUED 
LIABILITIES</font></div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On May 12, 2015, the Company entered into a secured loan 
facility with CPPIB Credit Investments Inc (&#8220;CPPIB&#8221;) for US 
$50,000.&#160;&#160;The loan bears interest at a rate of 7.5% per annum payable 
in cash on a quarterly basis.&#160;&#160;The principal is payable on or before 
the maturity date based on cash flow availability, the maturity date being May 
12, 2020.&#160;&#160;The loan facility is secured by a pledge of all Company 
owned assets.&#160;&#160;The US$50,000 was drawn on May 12, 2015 and the Company
granted CPPIB 10,000,000 common share purchase warrants (&#8220;Warrants&#8221;)
exercisable on or before May 12, 2020, at a price of $1.715 per 
Warrant.&#160;&#160;Transaction costs related to the Loan Facility amounted to 
$2,674.&#160;&#160;As the Loan Facility is denominated in US dollars, foreign 
exchange represents the effect of the change in the CAD/USD exchange rate 
between the date of receipt of funds and the reporting date.</font></div>
<div align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div align="justify">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">12.</font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">LONG-TERM DEBT
</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: 
inline">(continued)</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">During 
the three months ended June 30, 2015, $693 of interest costs related to the loan
facility were capitalized to the Phoenix Gold Project.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">(b)</font>&#160;&#160; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Finance Lease Obligations</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times 
New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">The Company has finance lease obligations in respect
of equipment at the Phoenix Gold Project. The lease agreements have a thirty-six
or sixty month term, carry an incremental borrowing rate of 2.9% or 4.5%, and 
allow the Company to purchase the assets at the end of the term for a nominal 
amount.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt" align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="98%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" width="64%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double; BORDER-
BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double; BORDER-
BOTTOM: black 2px solid; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-TOP: black 4px double;
BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Less than 1 year</font></div>
</td>

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
-18pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; DISPLAY: inline">Provisions</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; PADDING-
BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 
10.1pt"></font>9,078</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; 
PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; PADDING-
BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 
10.1pt"></font>2,263</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; 
PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">(a)</font>&#160;&#160; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Provision for Closure and Reclamation</font></font></div>
</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">The Company&#8217;s provision for closure and reclamation is for its 
Phoenix Gold Project. Closure and reclamation activities related to this project
will include land rehabilitation, demolition of buildings and processing 
facilities, ongoing care and maintenance and other costs.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The current estimated value of the future liability as of June 
30, 2015 is $2,478 (December 31, 2014 - $2,263).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The estimated closure costs of the Phoenix Gold Project, based 
on the current condition of the site, were inflation adjusted to the estimated 
date of site remediation, which is 14 years from June 30, 2015, and then 
discounted back to the year-end using an estimate of the risk free rate as of 
June 30, 2015 of 1.68% (December 31, 2014 &#8211; 1.79%).&#160;&#160;Accretion 
of the discount during the year was recorded to interest expense. The revision 
to the value of the future estimated liability, amounting to $196 (December 31, 
2014 - $(595)), was recognized on June 30, 2015 with an offsetting amount added 
to exploration and evaluation assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">

INDENT: 0pt">
