FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">UNITED STATES EXPLORATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Nevada and Utah 
Properties in the Long Canyon Gold District</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Rubicon controls approximately 350 square miles of variable fee
simple mineral property interests in the emerging Long Canyon gold district that
straddles the Nevada-Utah border in the United States (&#8220;<font style="FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Nevada Properties</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline">West Kirkland 
Mining Inc. (&#8220;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">West Kirkland</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#8221;) held an option over the Nevada Properties and did not complete 
the required minimum earn in expenditures during 2014.&#160;&#160;As a result, 
Rubicon terminated the agreement effective February 18, 2015. </font><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline">West Kirkland had spent approximately 
US$3 million on preliminary test work and drilling in four main targets: Toano, 
Lewis Spring, 12 Mile and Bandito. </font>Rubicon has begun the process of 
exploring options to obtain value for its Nevada Properties and continues to 
believe the properties are highly prospective.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline">For more 
information on the Nevada Properties targets, please visit our website at 
www.rubiconminerals.com under &#8220;</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Projects</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
DISPLAY: inline">&#8221;. </font>Rubicon has begun the process of exploring 
options to obtain value for the Nevada Claims and continues to believe the 
properties are highly prospective.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">CORPORATE DEVELOPMENTS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">CPPIB Loan 
Facility</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On May 12, 2015, the Company entered into a secured loan 
facility with CPPIB Credit Investments Inc (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; DISPLAY: inline">CPPIB</font>&#8221;) for US$50.0 million (&#8220;<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Loan 
Facility</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Loan Facility bears interest at a rate 
of 7.5% per annum payable in cash on a quarterly basis.&#160;&#160;The principal
is payable on or before the maturity date based on cash flow availability, the 
maturity date being May 12, 2020.&#160;&#160;The Loan Facility is secured by a 
pledge of all Company owned assets.&#160;&#160;The US$50.0 million was drawn on 
May 12, 2015 and the Company granted CPPIB 10,000,000 common share purchase 
warrants (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">Warrants</font>&#8221;) exercisable on or before May 12, 2020, at a 
price of $1.715 per Warrant.&#160;&#160;Transaction costs related to the Loan 
Facility amounted to $2.7 million.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160;</font>The proceeds from the Loan Facility will be used for the 
development of the Phoenix Gold Project and to provide adequate working capital 
and flexibility to optimize the Project.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Flow-Through Share 
Issuance</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On April 9, 2015, the Company closed a public flow-through 
share offering of 23,600,000 common shares on a &#8220;flow-through&#8221; basis
under the Income Tax Act (Canada) at a price of $1.28 per flow-through share for
aggregate gross proceeds of $30.2 million.&#160;&#160;The Company incurred share
issuance costs of $2.0 million including an underwriter&#8217;s commission 
representing 5% of the gross proceeds.&#160;&#160;As at June 30, 2015, the 
Company estimates it has spent $23.3 million on eligible 
expenditures.&#160;&#160;The Company expects the full amount of the offering 
will be renounced to investors with an effective renunciation date of December 
31, 2015.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font>The gross 
proceeds from the Offering will be used to incur eligible Canadian Exploration 
Expenses.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Long-Term Electricity 
Cost Savings Program</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On May 20, 2015, the Company was accepted into the Industrial 
Electricity Incentive Stream 3 Program (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; 
DISPLAY: inline">IEI Program</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;As part of the 9-year 
IEI Program, the Company anticipates an average electricity cost saving of 
approximately $4.0 million per full year of operations based on 2014 electricity
rate information. The IEI Program is expected to commence in the fourth quarter 
of 2015.&#160;&#160;On May 20, 2015, the Company posted a deposit of $1.1 
million as part of the terms of this agreement.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-7-</font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Power 
Agreements</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In February 2015, the Company entered into a series of 
agreements to secure the remaining electric grid power requirements for the 
Phoenix Gold Project.&#160;&#160;On February 25, 2015, the Company posted 
security of $7.8 million, in the form of a letter of credit, to secure these 
obligations.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The cost to the Company as a result of these agreements is 
dependent on a number of factors including the cost to construct the required 
power line upgrades and power usage levels over the life of the 
agreements.&#160;&#160;During the second quarter of 2015 the Company accrued a 
provision in the amount of $6.6 million related to these 
agreements.&#160;&#160;The cost of the infrastructure power agreements, in 
excess of amounts accrued, is estimated to be between $2.7-$16.5 million, and 
expected to be settled between 2016 and 2018.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Employee Share Purchase 
Plan</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On June 24, 2015, at the Company&#8217;s annual general and 
special meeting of shareholders, shareholder approval was granted for the 
establishment of the Employee Share Purchase Plan (&#8220;<font style="FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">ESPP</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The ESPP is 
designed to advance the Company&#8217;s interests by encouraging officers and 
employees to acquire equity in the Company by way of acquisition of common 
shares through the ESPP.&#160;&#160;Officers and employees of the Company are 
entitled to contribute up to 6% of their annual gross base salary to the ESPP
and the Company will contribute an amount equal to 50% of each ESPP 
participant&#8217;s contribution.&#160;&#160;The combined contribution will then
be used to purchase common shares of the Company from treasury on a quarterly 
basis.&#160;&#160;The ESPP is expected to commence in 2016.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline">Long Term Incentive 
Plan</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In the first quarter of 2015 the Company established a Long-
Term Incentive Plan consisting of Restricted Share Units (&#8220;<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RSU</font>&#8221;) and Performance 
Share Units (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">PSU</font>&#8221;) for directors and certain employees of the 
Company.&#160;&#160;On June 24, 2015, at the Company&#8217;s annual general and 
special meeting of shareholders, shareholder approval was obtained to modify the
terms of the RSUs and PSUs, at the discretion of the Board, to issue of the 
equivalent number of common shares in lieu of a cash payment.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: 
inline">QUALIFIED PERSONS AND QUALITY ASSURANCE</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Phoenix Gold Project drill core assays were conducted on sawn 
NQ-sized half core sections. The saw blade is routinely cleaned between samples 
when visible gold is noted during logging and sampling of the drill core. All 
assays were conducted by SGS Minerals Services using standard fire assay on a 50
gram (1 assay ton) sample with a gravimetric finish procedure. Assays are uncut 
as is standard practice in Red Lake. Standards, blanks and check assays were 
included at regular intervals in each sample batch. Check assays on 5% of 
samples are carried out by ALS Minerals, a third party independent laboratory. 
Gold standards were prepared by CDN Resource Laboratories Ltd.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The content relating to the PEA has been read and approved by 
SRK staff including Mr.&#160;&#160;S&#233;bastien Bernier, P.Geo., Principal 
Consultant (Resource Geology), Mr. Glen Cole, P.Geo., Principal Consultant 
(Resource Geology), and Mr. Stephen Taylor P. Eng., Principal Consultant 
(Mining) and Mr. Pierre Roy, ing., P. Eng., of Soutex Inc., all independent
Qualified Persons as defined by NI 43-101. The PEA was prepared by SRK with 
metallurgical and processing contributions from Soutex Inc. Individual 
contributing authors are Mr. S&#233;bastien Bernier, Mr. Glen Cole, Mr. Stephen 
Taylor, and Mr. Dan Hewitt of SRK and Mr. Pierre Roy ing., P. Eng., of Soutex 
Inc. All are independent Qualified Persons as defined by NI 43-101.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-8-</font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Phoenix Gold Project operations, including engineering studies 
and ongoing development are currently supervised and verified by, and except 
with respect to the third party prepared PEA, any operating technical data 
disclosed in this MD&amp;A has been verified by, and the technical operating 
disclosures in this MD&amp;A, have been approved by Bill Shand, P. Eng., Vice 
President Operations for Rubicon, a Qualified Person as defined in NI 43-
101.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Mark Ross, B.Sc., P. Geo., Chief Mine Geologist for the Company
and Howard Bird, B.Sc. (Hons.), P.Geo., Vice President, Exploration for the
Company, are Qualified Persons and employees of the Company and have reviewed 
and approved the disclosure of technical and scientific information included in 
this MD&amp;A.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">RISKS AND UNCERTAINTIES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The success of the Company depends upon a number of factors, 
many of which are beyond the control of Rubicon. Typical risk factors and 
uncertainties, among others, include political risks, financing risks, title 
risks, commodity prices, exchange rate risks, permitting risks, operating and 
environmental hazards encountered in the exploration, development and mining 
business and changing laws and public policies. Risk factors are more fully 
described in our Annual Information Form (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold;
DISPLAY: inline">AIF</font>&#8221;), dated March 27, 2015, for the year ended 
December 31, 2014, on file at www.sedar.com and <font style="TEXT-DECORATION: 
underline; DISPLAY: inline">www.sec.gov/edgar.shtml</font>.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">OPERATING RESULTS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Three Months ended June 30, 2015 compared to
the Three Months ended June 30, 2014</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the three months ended June 30, 2015 the Company had net 
income of $1.1 million and net income per share of $0.00 compared to a net loss 
of $3.0 million and a net loss per share of $0.01 for the three months ended 
June 30, 2014, an increase of $4.1 million.&#160;&#160;Comprehensive income for 
the three months ended June 30, 2015 was $1.1 million compared to comprehensive 
loss of $2.7 million for the prior year comparative period, an increase of $3.8 
million.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Six Months ended June 30, 2015 compared to 
the Six Months ended June 30, 2014</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the six months ended June 30, 2015 the Company had a net 
loss of $8.3 million and a net loss per share of $0.02 compared to a net loss of
$7.3 million and a net loss per share of $0.02 for the six months ended June 30,
2014, an increased loss of $1.0 million.&#160;&#160;Comprehensive loss for the 
six months ended June 30, 2015 was $8.4 million compared to comprehensive loss 
of $7.0 million for the prior year comparative period, a decrease of $1.4 
million.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Significant factors in line items that caused the change in net
loss and comprehensive loss for the six months ended June 30, 2015 as compared 
to the six months ended June 30, 2014 were as follows:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18.25pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline" face="Symbol, serif"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#9679;</font></font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Consulting and professional fees decreased by $2.0 million due 
to non-recurring professional and advisory fees incurred during the first 
quarter of 2014 in connection with the Gold Stream Facility;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18.25pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline" face="Symbol, serif"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#9679;</font></font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Salaries and benefits increased by $1.1 million primarily due 
to the addition of administrative staff to support the Company&#8217;s increased
operations;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18.25pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY:

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline" face="Symbol, serif"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#9679;</font></font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Share based compensation increased by $1.4 million primarily 
due to the introduction of a long-term incentive plan and the timing of issuance
of increased stock options in the current year;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>

<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18.25pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY:

</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Interest and other income decreased by $0.4 million primarily 
due to a lower average carried balance and lower interest rate earned on cash 
and cash equivalents in the current period as compared to the preceding prior-
year period;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Foreign exchange losses increased by $3.5 million due to 
movement in the Canadian / US dollar exchange rate and its effect on the 
Company&#8217;s Gold Stream Facility and Loan Facility liabilities, which are 
denominated in US dollar, and on the US dollar denominated cash and cash 
equivalents held by the Company;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Annual totals in the table may differ slightly from annual 
reported amounts due to rounding.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Overall, quarterly losses should tend to increase due to 
increased administration costs to support an expanding exploration and 
development program. Other factors generally causing significant variations in 
results between quarters include share-based compensation, fair value 
adjustments on the Gold Stream Facility, fair value adjustment on the Warrant 
Liability,&#160;&#160;foreign exchange gains and losses, gain or loss on sale of
investments and mineral property option payments received in excess of property 
costs.&#160;&#160;See operating results, above, for discussion of movement in 
net income (loss) for the three and six months ending June 30, 2015 as compared 
to net income (loss) for the three and six months ending June 30, 
2014.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">FINANCIAL CONDITION, LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL 
RESOURCES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company had working capital of $58.2 million at June 30, 
2015 compared to $82.8 million at December 31, 2014. Working capital decreased 
in the current year by $24.6 million, primarily due to development expenditures 
and other costs incurred during the year on the Phoenix Gold 
Project.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On April 9, 2015, the Company closed a bought deal private 
placement financing of 23,600,000 common shares on a &#8220;flow-through&#8221; 
basis under the Income Tax Act (Canada) at a price of $1.28 per flow-through 
share for aggregate gross proceeds of $30.2 million.&#160;&#160;The gross 
proceeds from the offering will be used to incur eligible Canadian Exploration 
Expenses.&#160;&#160;The proceeds are inclusive of an overallotment option that
was fully exercised on closing.&#160;&#160;In connection with the offering, the 
Company incurred share issuance costs of $2.0 million including an 
underwriter&#8217;s commission representing 5% of the gross 
proceeds.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On May 12, 2015, the Company entered into a financing agreement
with CPPIB Credit Investments Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of the CPPIB, for 
a US$50 million secured Loan Facility.&#160;&#160;The Loan Facility has a five-
year term that will mature on May 12, 2020, with the entire principal amount 
payable at maturity.&#160;&#160;The Loan Facility bears an annual cash interest 
rate of 7.5%, compounded quarterly.&#160;&#160;In consideration for the Loan 
Facility, the Company issued 10,000,000 warrants to CPPIB.&#160;&#160;Each 
warrant gives the holder the right to purchase one common share in the Company 
for a price of $1.715 exercisable up to and including May 12, 2020.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">CASH FLOWS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Three Months ended June 30, 2015 compared to
the Three Months ended June 30, 2014</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the three months ended June 30, 2015, the Company had net 
cash inflows of $19.4 million compared to net cash outflows of $27.3 million in 
the three months ended June 30, 2014, an increase of net cash inflows of $46.7 
million.&#160;&#160;Proceeds from financing activities, partially offset by 
spending on the Phoenix Gold Project, contributed to the net cash inflows 
increase for the current period.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Operating Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Net cash from operating activities was $4.0 million for the 
three months ended June 30, 2015 compared with net cash used in operating 
activities of $3.1 million for the three months ending June 30, 2014, 
representing an increase of net cash inflow of $7.1 million. The increase in 
cash used in operating activities was a result of increases in non-cash working 
capital primarily due to payment of trade payables and accrued liabilities, and 
a decrease in the net loss as discussed in operating results above.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Investing Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">$71.5 million of net cash was used in investing activities for 
the three months ended June 30, 2015 compared with net cash used in investing 
activities of $22.9 million for the three months ended June 30, 2014, a 
difference of $48.6 million between periods. The change was due to an increase 
in expenditures related to the construction of the Phoenix Gold Project in the 
current year partially off-set by proceeds from restricted cash.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Financing Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Financing activities generated $85.5 million of cash in the 
three months ended June 30, 2015 as the Company issued Flow-Through Common 
Shares, for net proceeds of $28.1 million, and entered into a Loan Facility for 
net proceeds of $57.7 million. Net cash used in the three months ending June 30,
2014 were $0.2 million reflecting minimal financing activities.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Six Months ended June 30, 2015 compared to 
the Six Months ended June 30, 2014</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">For the six months ended June 30, 2015, the Company had net 
cash outflows of $42.8 million compared to net cash inflows of $104.5 million in
the six months ended June 30, 2014, an increase of net cash outflows of $147.3 
million. Increases in spending at the Phoenix Gold Project and reduction in 
proceeds from financing activities contributed to the net cash outflows increase
for the current period.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Operating Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Net cash used in operating activities was $9.6 million for the 
six months ended June 30, 2015 compared with net cash used in operating 
activities of $3.8 million for the six months ending June 30, 2014, representing
an increase of net cash outflow of $5.8 million. The increase in cash used in 
operations results from significant changes in non-cash working capital 
primarily due to payment of trade payables and accrued liabilities, and an 
increase in the net loss as discussed in operating results above.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Investing Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">$138.1 million of net cash was used in investing activities for
the six months ended June 30, 2015 compared with net cash used in investing 
activities of $31.0 million for the six months ended June 30, 2014, a 
difference&#160;&#160;of $107.1 million between periods. The change was due in 
part to an increase in expenditures related to the construction of the Phoenix 
Gold Project in the current year. Additionally, no temporary investments matured
in the current period compared to $10 million that matured during the six months
ended June 30, 2014, and cash used in restricted cash of $5.8 million in the six
months ended June 30, 2015 compared to cash proceeds from restricted cash of 
$3.9 million during the six months ended June 30, 2014.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT:

</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt;

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Financing Activities</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Financing activities generated $101.0 million of cash in the 
six months ended June 30, 2015 as the Company received the final deposit from 
the Gold Stream Facility, issued Flow-Through Common Shares, and entered into a 
Loan Facility. Proceeds from financing in the six months ending June 30, 2014 
were $140.5 million primarily due to a public offering and proceeds from the 
Gold Stream Facility.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s financial instrument policies and fair 
values by category are described in Notes 2, 4, 14 and 15 to the financial 
statements. Overall, the Company&#8217;s most significant risk exposure relates 
to its cash and cash equivalents, Warrant Liability, and Gold Stream 
Facility.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s paramount concern with respect to cash and 
cash equivalents balances is preservation of capital and therefore, during the 
period, authorized investments were restricted to instruments guaranteed by the 
Government of Canada or a Province of Canada or high-grade money market 
instruments.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company entered into a Gold Stream Facility in 2014 as 
described herein under the section &#8220;<font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
DISPLAY: inline">Significant accounting judgments and sources of estimation 
uncertainty</font>&#8221;. Calculation of the Gold Stream Facility fair value is
subject to risks and uncertainties related to variables contained in the 
Company&#8217;s valuation model. Management seeks to mitigate these risks in 
consideration of experience, internal and external sources of information and 
expectations of future events that management believes to be reasonable in the 
circumstances.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company entered into a Warrant Liability in 2015 as 
described herein under the section &#8220;<font style="FONT-STYLE: italic;
DISPLAY: inline">Significant accounting judgments and sources of estimation 
uncertainty</font>&#8221;. Calculation of the Warrant Liability fair value is 
subject to risks and uncertainties related to variables contained in the Black-
Scholes option pricing model.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">OFF-BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company does not have any off-balance sheet arrangements, 
other than commitment and contingencies, as described in Note 20 to the 
Financial Statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">PROVISION FOR CLOSURE AND 
RECLAMATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company has an obligation to close and rehabilitate the 
Phoenix Gold Project site upon its abandonment.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The estimated closure costs of the Phoenix Gold Project based 
on the period-end condition of the site were inflation adjusted to the estimated
date of site remediation, which is 14 years from June 30, 2015, and then 
discounted back to the year-<font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 12pt"></font>end
using an estimate of the risk-free rate of 1.68%. The provision for closure and 
reclamation as at June 30, 2015 increased to $2.5 million (December 31, 2014 - 
$2.3 million) with the increase, after accretion of the discount of the prior 
estimate, added to exploration and evaluation assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">On April 10, 2015, the Company replaced a restricted deposit 
with a surety bond in the amount of $3.5 million as security for reclamation and
closure obligations of the Phoenix Gold project with the Ontario </font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-13-</font></font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-

0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>

DISPLAY: inline">Ministry of Northern Development and Mines (&#8220;<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">MNDM</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;As of
June 30, 2015, the Company has deposited a total of $nil (December 31, 2014 - 
$3.4 million) with the MNDM.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top; DISPLAY:
inline">(1)</font>Subject to change see Note 15 &#8220;<font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; DISPLAY: inline">Gold Stream Facility</font>&#8221; within the Notes to 
the Financial Statements for further discussion of this obligation.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company is required to make certain cash payments and incur
exploration costs to maintain its mineral properties in good standing. These 
payments and costs are at the Company&#8217;s discretion and are based upon 
available financial resources and the exploration merits of the mineral 
properties which are evaluated on a periodic basis.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; DISPLAY: inline">In February 2015, the Company entered into certain 
agreements necessary to secure the remaining hydroelectric grid power 
requirements for the Phoenix Gold Project once it enters 
production.&#160;&#160;The cost to the Company as a result of these agreements 
is dependent on a number of factors including the cost to construct the required
power line upgrades.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2015 the estimated cost of these 
agreements, in excess of amounts accrued and as described in Note 13 to the 
Financial Statements - Provisions and Other Liabilities, is estimated to be 
between $2.7 million and $16.5 million.&#160;&#160;The balance remains unaccrued
as it is contingent on uncertain future events.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-14-</font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">CRITICAL ACCOUNTING JUDGMENTS AND 
ESTIMATES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company&#8217;s accounting policies are described in detail
in Note 2 of the December 31, 2014 annual consolidated financial statements. The
Company considers the following judgments and estimates to be most critical in 
understanding its financial results:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Significant accounting judgments and 
sources of estimation uncertainty</font></div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The preparation of financial statements in conformity with IFRS
requires management to make judgments, estimates and assumptions that affect the
reported amounts and the valuation of assets and liabilities and the disclosure 
of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenues and expenditures during the period reported. 
Management uses its best estimates for these purposes, based on assumptions that
it believes reflect the most probable set of economic conditions and planned 
courses of action. Estimates of the future price of gold pose a significant risk
to the valuation of the Phoenix Gold Project and the impairment review of 
carrying values as described below.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Impairment of non-current non-financial 
assets</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The Company reviews and evaluates the carrying value of each of
its non-current non-financial assets for impairment when events or changes in 
circumstances indicate that the carrying amounts of the related asset may not be
recoverable. The identification of such events or changes and the performance of
the assessment requires significant judgment. Furthermore, management&#8217;s 
estimates of many of the factors relevant to completing this assessment, 
including commodity prices, foreign currency exchange rates, mineral resources, 
and operating, capital and reclamation costs, are subject to risks and 
uncertainties that may affect the determination of the recoverability of the 
carrying amounts of its non-current non-financial assets.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The determination of fair value and value in use requires 
management to make estimates and assumptions about expected production and sales
volumes, gold prices, mine plan estimates, operating costs, mine closure and 
restoration costs, future capital expenditures and appropriate discount rates 
for future cash flows. The estimates and assumptions are subject to risk and 
uncertainty and, as such, there is the possibility that changes in circumstances
will alter these projections, which may impact the recoverable amount of the 
assets. In such circumstances, some or all of the carrying value of the assets 
may be further impaired or the impairment charge reduced with the impact 
recorded in the statement of income.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As at June 30, 2015, management of the Company determined that 
the volatile price of gold, escalating costs in the industry and the 
Company&#8217;s depressed share price had not resulted in a market 
capitalization below the carrying amount of the Company&#8217;s net assets 
indicating that the assets were not impaired. Although the result of this test 
did not indicate impairment, the Company completed an impairment assessment for 
the Phoenix Gold Project that included an estimate of the Project&#8217;s value 
in use.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">Key assumptions incorporated in the impairment model included 
the following:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>

0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font>
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><br>
</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-15-</font></font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Management&#8217;s impairment assessment did not result in the 
identification of an impairment loss as of June 30, 2015. Although management 
believes the estimates applied in these impairment assessments are reasonable, 
such estimates are subject to significant uncertainties and judgments. 
Sensitivities to changes in gold price, grade, and estimated operating costs, 
that differ from current projections, and increases to estimated capital costs 
might trigger an impairment that could be material.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 8.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">Financial liabilities at fair value through 
profit and loss</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As discussed in Note 14 to the Financial Statement &#8211; 
Warrant Liability, the Company entered into a secured loan facility with CPPIB 
for US$50.0 million on May 12, 2015.&#160;&#160;As part of the loan facility the
Company granted CPPIB 10,000,000 Warrants exercisable on or before May 12, 2020,
at a price of $1.715 per Warrant.&#160;&#160;The Company reviewed the terms of 
the Warrant agreement and determined that IAS 39 Financial Instruments: 
Recognition and Measurement is the applicable standard under which the 
accounting for the agreement should be evaluated. As the Warrant agreement meets
the criteria for treatment as a financial liability through profit and loss, the
Company designated it as such with initial and subsequent measurement at fair 
value.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value of the Warrants Liability on initial recognition and
in subsequent periods is determined using the Black-Scholes option pricing 
model. Subsequent fair value is calculated on each reporting date with gains and
losses recorded in profit and loss as other fair value adjustments.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">As discussed in Note 15 to the Financial Statements - Gold 
Stream Facility, the Company entered into a Gold Stream Facility with Royal Gold
on February 10, 2014. The Company reviewed the terms of the agreement and 
determined that IAS 39 Financial Instruments: Recognition and Measurement is the
applicable standard under which the accounting for the agreement should be 
evaluated. In accordance with this standard, the Company concluded that the 
agreement represents an embedded derivative within a host debt instrument 
(purchase and sale agreement for gold). As the entire hybrid contract meets the 
criteria for treatment as a financial liability through profit and loss, the 
Company has designated it as such with initial and subsequent measurement at 
fair value. Transaction costs directly attributable to the Gold Stream Facility 
are expensed through profit and loss as incurred.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Fair value of the Gold Stream Facility on initial recognition 
is determined by the amount of the cash advance received. Subsequent fair value 
is calculated on each reporting date with gains and losses recorded in profit 
and loss as fair value and foreign exchange adjustments. Components of the 
adjustment to fair value at each reporting date include:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: 
inline">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; DISPLAY: inline" face="Symbol, serif"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#9679;</font></font></font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Accretion expense due to passage of time</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">

</td>

</td>

liability is incurred in USD</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"

</td>

DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">Estimates and assumptions underlying the fair value 
calculations are reviewed on an ongoing basis in consideration of experience, 
internal and external sources of information and expectations of future events 
that management believes to be reasonable in the circumstances.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;
<div id="PGBRK" style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
DISPLAY: inline">-16-</font></div>
</div>
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; DISPLAY: inline">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">CHANGES IN ACCOUNTING POLICIES INCLUDING
INITIAL ADOPTION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 15, &#8220;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customers&#8221;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">In May 2014, the IASB and the Financial Accounting Standards 
Board (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: 
inline">FASB</font>&#8221;) completed its joint project to clarify the 
principles for recognizing revenue and to develop a common revenue standard for 
IFRS and United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (&#8220;<font 
style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">US GAAP</font>&#8221;). As a result 
of the joint project, the IASB issued IFRS 15, Revenue from Contracts with 
Customers (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 
15</font>&#8221;). IFRS 15 establishes principles to address the nature, amount,
timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising from an entity&#8217;s 
contracts with customers.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 15 will be effective for annual periods beginning on or 
after January 1, 2018, with early adoption permitted. We are currently assessing
the effect of this standard on our financial statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 9, &#8220;Financial 
Instruments&#8221;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The IASB issued its completed version of IFRS 9, Financial 
Instruments (&#8220;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">IFRS 
9</font>&#8221;) in July 2014. The completed standard provides revised guidance 
on the classification and measurement of financial assets. It also introduces a 
new expected credit loss model for calculating impairment for financial assets. 
The new hedging guidance that was issued in November 2013 is incorporated into 
this new final standard.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">This final version of IFRS 9 will be effective for annual 
periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018, with early adoption permitted. We
are currently assessing the effect of this standard on our financial 
statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL 
REPORTING</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">The 
Company's&#160;&#160;management&#160;&#160;is&#160;&#160;responsible&#160;&#160;
for&#160;&#160;establishing&#160;&#160;and&#160;&#160;maintaining 
adequate&#160;&#160;internal&#160;&#160;control 
over&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;reporting.&#160;&#160;Any system of 
internal control over financial reporting, no matter how well designed, has 
inherent limitations.&#160;&#160;Therefore,&#160;&#160;even 
those&#160;&#160;systems&#160;&#160;determined&#160;&#160;to be 
effective&#160;&#160;can 
provide&#160;&#160;only&#160;&#160;reasonable&#160;&#160;&#160;assurance&#160;&#
160;with&#160;&#160;respect&#160;&#160;to&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;&#160;
statement preparation and presentation.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; DISPLAY: inline">CHANGES IN INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL 
REPORTING</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
DISPLAY: inline">There have been no changes in the Company&#8217;s internal 
control over financial reporting during the quarter ended June 30, 
2015&#160;&#160;that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to 
materially affect, its internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
